Description: Sets the server name visible in the game browser
Sets the password required to connect to the server. Default is no password
Sets the password required for admin access to the server. Default is no password
Sets the password required by alternate syntax of "serverCommand" server-side scripting. Default is no password
See the Security and Privacy menu for configurable options for the server's RCON
Sets the list of [Steam64 IDs](https://steamidfinder.com/) for server admins. Format is "SteamID","SteamID"
Sets the player welcome message (MOTD). Format is "Line1","Line 2"
DefaultValue: "Welcome to Arma 3","Hosted using AMP by CubeCoders"

Description: Sets the time interval between display of each line of the MOTD
Sets the maximum number of clients (including headless clients) that may connect to the server at one time

Semi-colon separated list (moddir1;moddir2) of [mod directories](https://discourse.cubecoders.com/t/arma-3-server-guide/3475#p-7295-h-42-loading-6) to load (not server-side only mods). ONE LINE ONLY! Specify simply the mod ID or @modname (as applicable to the Updates settings) for any mods downloaded under Updates. Otherwise, use mod directory paths relative to the server base directory or full paths. Alternatively use the Startup Parameters File option

Semi-colon separated list (moddir1;moddir2) of [server-side only mod directories](https://discourse.cubecoders.com/t/arma-3-server-guide/3475#p-7295-h-42-loading-6) to load (the mods are not broadcast to clients). ONE LINE ONLY! Specify simply the mod ID or @modname (as applicable to the Updates settings) for any mods downloaded under Updates. Otherwise, use mod directory paths relative to the server base directory or full paths. Alternatively use the Startup Parameters File option

Semi-colon separated list (moddir1;moddir2) of [client-side only mod directories](https://discourse.cubecoders.com/t/arma-3-server-guide/3475#p-7295-h-42-loading-6). ONE LINE ONLY! These won't be loaded by the server, but will be used by the Manage Bikeys setting if enabled. Specify simply the mod ID or @modname (as applicable to the Updates settings) for any mods downloaded under Updates. Otherwise, use mod directory paths relative to the server base directory or full paths

If enabled, the bikey files for each of the mods specified in Load Mods and Client Mods will be copied to the 'keys' directory on server start, to enable addon signature verification. All existing bikeys in that directory (other than the default 'a3.bikey') will be deleted

If required, you can change the binding of the server and BattlEye RCON by changing the Application IP Binding for this instance. NOTE: The IP must be reachable by AMP, otherwise AMP's console won't work
If enabled, players with an ID that is identical to another player will be kicked
If enabled, players with unknown or unsigned mods will not be allowed to join
Specifies whether to prevent or allow file patching for clients
Sets a whitelist of [Steam64 IDs](https://steamidfinder.com/) for clients allowed to use file patching. Format is "SteamID","SteamID"

Sets the minimum client version, below which clients won't be allowed to join. Default of 99999999 equates to the server version. NOTE: If the server uses the Performance Profiling Build in any way, set this to 0, otherwise no client can connect
If enabled, the server will be forced into LAN mode - only local clients can connect

Sets the number of headless clients to launch when the server starts. Further information on configuration is [here](https://discourse.cubecoders.com/t/arma-3-generic-guide/3475#h-6-headless-clients-9)
Sets the maximum time allowed for the server to successfully start, for any headless clients to be launched. If the server takes longer to start, the clients will not be launched
Sets the IPs of headless clients able to connect to the server. Multiples connections and IPs are allowed. Format is "IP1","IP2"

DisplayName: Use Headless Client Startup Parameters File
Description: If enabled, allows the use of a [parameters file](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Startup_Parameters_Config_File) for additional startup parameters for headless clients. File is "hc_parameters.txt" in the server base directory. Useful if the server also uses its own Startup Parameters File for mods. Use with care
Sets the IPs of those headless clients listed under Headless Client IPs that have unlimited bandwidth and nearly no latency. Format is "IP1","IP2"
Sets the limit for the server FPS. Setting this too high can have an effect on server performance
If enabled, the server will automatically create port mappings on UPnP/IGD enabled routers
Specifies additional startup parameters that are not otherwise set by AMP. Alternatively, use the Startup Parameters File option. Use with care

If enabled, allows the use of a [parameters file](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Startup_Parameters_Config_File) for additional startup parameters for the server. File is "parameters.txt" in the server base directory. Useful for long startup parameters such as -mod or -serverMod. Use with care
If enabled, joining players will skip role selection
Sets the minimum number of players required before displaying the mission selection screen
Sets the fraction (0.00 to 1.00) of players needed to vote something into effect
Sets the Advanced Flight Model mode
If set, players will not be able to use in-game voice chat
Sets the voice chat codec type
Sets the voice sound range: 1-10 is 8kHz (narrowband), 11-20 is 16kHz (wideband), 21-30 is 32kHz (SPEEX) or 48kHz (OPUS) (ultrawideband)
If enabled, begins the mission immediately instead of waiting for players to join (autoInit). Requires Persistent Mission to be enabled
If enabled, the mission keeps running when all players disconnect. Required for "autoInit" (Start Mission Immediately option)

If enabled, the server auto-starts the next mission in the mission cycle and waits for players in the role selection. Requires a [mission cycle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Server_Config_File#Mission_rotation) to be specified in AMP_server.cfg

If enabled, the server randomly chooses a mission from the mission cycle for starting or auto-starting. Requires a [mission cycle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Server_Config_File#Mission_rotation) to be specified in AMP_server.cfg
If enabled, gives the ability to place markers and draw lines in map
If disabled, glasses set in a player's profile will be ignored
Forces the selected difficulty on the server. To use custom difficulty settings, you must configure them in the profile within the A3Master directory
If enabled, the server will opt into [Arma 3 game analytics](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Analytics)
Only allows files with the listed extensions to be loaded via the loadFile command
Only allows files with the listed extensions to be loaded via the preprocessFile / preprocessFileLineNumbers commands
Only allows files and URLs with the listed extensions to be loaded via the htmlLoad command
Sets the format of the time stamps used in the log file
If enabled, the server logs players' bandwidth and desync info every 60 seconds, as well as "network message is pending" owner identity
Sets [server side scripting](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Armed_Assault:_Server_Side_Scripting) to run when a user has connected
Sets [server side scripting](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Armed_Assault:_Server_Side_Scripting) to run when a user has disconnected

DisplayName: Run Script On Double ID Detected
Description: Sets [server side scripting](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Armed_Assault:_Server_Side_Scripting) to run when a second user with the same ID is detected
Sets [server side scripting](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Armed_Assault:_Server_Side_Scripting) to run when a user is kicked
Sets [server side scripting](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Armed_Assault:_Server_Side_Scripting) to run when unsigned data is detected
Sets [server side scripting](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Armed_Assault:_Server_Side_Scripting) to run when a modification of a signed pbo is detected

Sets [server side scripting](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/ArmA:_Armed_Assault:_Server_Side_Scripting) to run when a signed pbo is detected with a valid signature, but is a different version than a server has. Use with caution
Sets the composition script permission level
Sets the maximum Steam query packet size. Increasing this value can be dangerous
If a server-initiated callExtension takes longer than the specified limit, a warning will be logged as well as reflected in the extension return result
If enabled, "object not found" messages will be logged
If enabled, parsing of description.ext/mission.sqm will be skipped. Will show pbo filename instead of configured missionName
If enabled, a mission will load regardless of the number of loading errors
If enabled, all of a player's message types and sizes are dumped to a logfile if #monitor is running and the player's Guaranteed Message Queue size goes above the set threshold
Sets the server wait time before disconnecting a player after loss of an active traffic connection (if Kick On Disconnect Timeout is enabled)
If enabled, players hitting the disconnect timeout will be kicked, otherwise that will just be logged
Sets the maximum desync value before the server kicks a player (if Kick On Maximum Desync is enabled)
If enabled, players hitting the maximum desync value will be kicked, otherwise that will just be logged
Sets the maximum latency (ping) before the server kicks a player (if Kick On Maximum Ping is enabled)
If enabled, players hitting the maximum latency (ping) value will be kicked, otherwise that will just be logged
Sets the maximum packet loss before the server kicks a player (if Kick On Maximum Packet Loss is enabled)
If enabled, players hitting the maximum packet loss value will be kicked, otherwise that will just be logged
Sets the time interval before a player can return after a manual kick (such as vote kick, admin kick, bruteforce detection). -1 = until mission end, -2 = until server restart
Sets the time interval before a player can return after a connectivity kick (ping, timeout, packetloss, desync). -1 = until mission end, -2 = until server restart
Sets the time interval before a player can return after a BattlEye kick. -1 = until mission end, -2 = until server restart
Sets the time interval before a player can return after a harmless kick (such as wrong addons, Steam timeout or checks, signatures, content, etc). -1 = until mission end, -2 = until server restart
Sets the time limit for voting. Format is <ready number>,<not ready number>
Sets the time limit for role selection. Format is <ready number>,<not ready number>
Sets the time limit for briefing. Format is <ready number>,<not ready number>
Sets the time limit for debriefing. Format is <ready number>,<not ready number>
Sets the time limit for lobby idle
Sets how long a player will wait for armaUnits data when connecting
Sets whether to run the 64 bit or 32 bit version of the server executable

Sets the [server branch](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Steam_Branches#Arma_3_Server) (or branches) to install. Some require a Beta Password. NOTE: Update the server after switching branches, and set the Minimum Client Version to 0 if using the Performance Profiling Build in any way!
If set, mods downloaded under "Steam workshop items" will be linked to the server base directory in the format @modname, rather than just by reference to the mod ID
